1.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first

2.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, to pull up, especially the tent-pins, i.e. start on ajourney
the front, of place (absolutely, the fore part, relatively the East) or time (antiquity); often used adverbially (before, anciently, eastward)
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
properly, a split, i.e. a wide level valley between mountains
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence

3.brief: a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
near, with or among; often in general, to
to give (whether literal or figurative); generally, to put; imperatively (reflexive) come
to be (or become) white;  to make bricks
a brick (from the whiteness of the clay)

4.brief: to give (whether literal or figurative); generally, to put; imperatively (reflexive) come
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
a tower (from its size or height); by analogy, a rostrum; figuratively, a (pyramidal) bed of flowers
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
to dash in pieces, literally or figuratively (especially to disperse)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
